instruction.description: Wash, cut, disgard wing tips and dry wings.
Mix plain, flour, corn flour, MSG, salt, white, black, schezwan pepper, chilli powder in bowl with enough water to make a thick yogurt like consistency.
Marinate wings in mix for at least an hour.
Deep fry wings on medium heat until golden and crispy. Do this in batches of 4 or 5, draining on paper towels when done.
Put in oven at 160 degrees celsius for 5 - 10 mins. This will ensure that they are cooked through and allow you time for a bit more chopping.
Chop garlic chilli and spring onion
Add a little oil to wok, fry garlic chilli and spring onion for 30 seconds then add the wings, just to coat in the mix.
Season with more salt and white pepper in the wok, and serve.

recipe.name: Spicy, Crispy, Salt and Pepper Wings
recipe.description: This is one of my favorite Chinese takeaway recipes to get you started. As with all my recipes I would tell you not to use any old spices (including pepper) that have been sitting at the back of the cupboard for years. They will probably just add a horrible musty taste and smell to the dish. The first time you cook any of these recipes, don't leave out or substitute ingredients. They are all there to build a particular layer of flavour and without it you won't get the same result.
recipe.alternativeIdeas: You could make this a little more fancy by using chicken patties by roughly chopping chicken thigh and binding with a little salt.
